page.title: 19The Bellfield Policies
page.content: Bellfield House and gardens belonged to the three Buchanan sisters. Sixty-one years ago on the death of the last sister, it was left to the people of Kilmarnock and Riccarton. Many people benefitted from the Buchanan Bequest and the Mansion House was used as a library and tearoom and was often used for wedding receptions. In 1970 the house was knocked down. Nearby three trees were planted and a plaque was plated in remembrance of the three sisters. Today Bellfield Estate is a public park with areas for tennis, football and bowling.
